title: Lutri Spikes to $72 and Gilt-Leaf Palace Surges: February Hot/Cold List

sections.narration: Three cards. Seventy-two dollars. One otter. Welcome to the February Hot List—these are the cards exploding right now.
sections.visual: Fast-paced title card with 'February Hot List' and flashing price arrows

sections.narration: First up—Lutri, the Spellchaser. This otter went from bulk to seventy-two dollars overnight. The Commander Format Panel unbanned it as your commander. The Halo Foil from Multiverse Legends? Seventy-two dollars. Players are building Izzet spell-slinger decks around this thing. Demand absolutely blindsided supply.
sections.visual: Lutri card full screen with animated price tag showing $6 jumping to $72

sections.narration: Next—Gilt-Leaf Palace. This Lorwyn tribal land was supposed to get reprinted in Lorwyn Eclipsed. It didn't. Collectors panicked. Four dollars last week. Now? Eighteen and climbing. Old-border printings are spec targets. If it dodges the next reprint, this could hit fifty dollars.
sections.visual: Gilt-Leaf Palace card with price ticker showing $4 to $18 surge

sections.narration: Why is Gilt-Leaf Palace spiking? Meet High Perfect Morcant. This new legend is driving Elfball dominance. When a commander can spike a twenty-year-old land, you know the deck is real. The synergy is undeniable—Morcant needs that mana, and players need Morcant.
sections.visual: High Perfect Morcant card art with Elfball archetype callout

sections.narration: Finally—the sideboard king. Torpor Orb. Pro Tour Richmond was packed with ETB decks. Veterans reached for this. It climbed to twelve dollars and it's now a Standard mainstay. Drop Orb, shut down their triggers, win the game. If you're not sideboarding this, you're behind.
sections.visual: Torpor Orb card with tournament playmat background

sections.narration: That's your February hot list. Lutri at seventy-two, Palace at eighteen, Morcant driving the meta, and Orb ruling sideboards. Which spike surprised you? Subscribe for market alerts every week.
sections.visual: End screen with subscribe button and card thumbnails

scenes.text: First up—Lutri, the Spellchaser. This otter went from bulk to seventy-two dollars overnight. The Commander Format Panel unbanned it as your commander. The Halo Foil from Multiverse Legends? Seventy-two dollars.

Next—Gilt-Leaf Palace. This Lorwyn tribal land was supposed to get reprinted in Lorwyn Eclipsed. It didn't. Collectors panicked. Four dollars last week. Now? Eighteen and climbing. Old-border printings are spec targets.
Why is Gilt-Leaf Palace spiking? Meet High Perfect Morcant. This new legend is driving Elfball dominance. When a commander can spike a twenty-year-old land, you know the deck is real.
Finally—the sideboard king. Torpor Orb. Pro Tour Richmond was packed with ETB decks. Veterans reached for this. It climbed to twelve dollars and it's now a Standard mainstay.

Eighteen and climbing. Old-border printings are spec targets. Why is Gilt-Leaf Palace spiking? Meet High Perfect Morcant. This new legend is driving Elfball dominance. When a commander can spike a twenty-year-old land, you know the deck is real. Finally—the sideboard king. Torpor Orb. Pro Tour Richmond was packed with ETB decks. Veterans reached for this. It climbed to twelve dollars and it's now a Standard mainstay.
